intro: Brickellia macromera, commonly known as the large-flowered brickellia, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Brickellia macromera is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, making it an adaptable species in arid environments.
